_header: That many hardy knight of great renown
Note:
The Scottish prose version by Hay, cited in Brown and Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown, and Rossell Hope Robbins. The Index of Middle English Verse. New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press, 1943 *55, apparently does not exist.
Bibliographic Ghosts: London, British Library Addit. 41063 (v) [olim Taymouth Castle]: see 5158-1 below.
_description: Gilbert Hay, Buik of Alexander — approximately 20,000 lines in couplets

BLAdd40732.First Lines:
That mony hardie knyght of gret renounInto the feild war slane and
                    strikin doun…
BLAdd40732.Last Lines:
…I pray to thame to pray to hevinis kingTo grant ws grace to
                    make ane guide ending
BLAdd40732.Attributed Title: Heir endis the buike off king allexander the conqueroure (f. 282)
BLAdd40732.Editions:
Herrmann,  Albert,
                        ed.  
             The Taymouth Castle Manuscript of Sir Gilbert Hay’s “The
                Buik of King Alexander the Conqueror”.
         R. Gaertners Verlagsbuchhandlung: Berlin, 1898. 
Ritchie,  Robert Lindsay Graeme,
                        ed.  
             The Buik of Alexander.
             4 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 12 (1925), 17 (1921), 21 (1927), 25 (1929) Edinburgh, London:
            Blackwood, 1921-29.

EDSROGD112.First Lines:
…That mony hardie knycht of gret renouneInto the feild var
                    slaine and strikin doune…
EDSROGD112.Last Lines:
…I pray to thame to pray to havinis kingTo grant vs grace to
                    mak ane guid ending
EDSROGD112.Attributed Title: heir endis the buik of king Alexander þe conquerour (p. 457)
EDSROGD112.Editions:
Extracts from the Buike of King Alexander the Conquerour, a MS. in the
                Library of Taymouth Castle, 1831.
         Bannatyne Club, 1834: (NB: Herrmann (1898)
XHerrmann,  Albert. 
             The Taymouth Castle Manuscript of Sir Gilbert Hay’s “The
                Buik of King Alexander the Conqueror”.
         R. Gaertners Verlagsbuchhandlung: Berlin, 1898 questions the
                        accuracy of this citation.).
